1. .vscode/extensions.json â€” Auto-Recommend Extensions
This tells VS Code: "Hey! Install these extensions automatically!"

json
{
  "recommendations": [
    "dbaeumer.vscode-eslint",
    "esbenp.prettier-vscode",
    "ms-python.python",
    "ms-vscode.cpptools",
    "rust-lang.rust-analyzer",
    "github.copilot",
    "github.vscode-pull-request-github",
    "tamasfe.even-better-toml",
    "yzhang.markdown-all-in-one"
  ]
}
What it does:

When someone opens HyperCode in VS Code, they get a notification:

"This workspace recommends extensions. Install all?"

One click â†’ all your recommended tools install automatically

2. .vscode/settings.json â€” Auto-Configure Workspace Settings
This auto-sets formatting, linting, file associations, etc.

json
{
  "editor.formatOnSave": true,
  "editor.defaultFormatter": "esbenp.prettier-vscode",
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.insertSpaces": true,
  "files.autoSave": "onFocusChange",
  "files.exclude": {
    "**/__pycache__": true,
    "**/node_modules": true,
    "**/.git": true
  },
  "[python]": {
    "editor.defaultFormatter": "ms-python.python",
    "editor.formatOnSave": true
  },
  "[rust]": {
    "editor.defaultFormatter": "rust-lang.rust-analyzer"
  },
  "[markdown]": {
    "editor.wordWrap": "on"
  },
  "python.linting.enabled": true,
  "python.linting.pylintEnabled": true,
  "rust-analyzer.checkOnSave.command": "clippy"
}
What it does:

Auto-saves files

Auto-formats code on save

Configures language-specific formatters

Hides junk folders (node_modules, __pycache__)

3. .vscode/tasks.json â€” Auto-Run Build/Test Tasks
This lets you run common tasks (build, test, run) with one click or keyboard shortcut.

json
{
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "tasks": [
    {
      "label": "Install Dependencies",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "npm install && pip install -r requirements.txt",
      "problemMatcher": [],
      "group": {
        "kind": "build",
        "isDefault": true
      }
    },
    {
      "label": "Run Tests",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "pytest tests/",
      "problemMatcher": []
    },
    {
      "label": "Build HyperCode",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "cargo build --release",
      "problemMatcher": []
    },
    {
      "label": "Start Dev Server",
      "type": "shell",
      "command": "npm run dev",
      "problemMatcher": []
    }
  ]
}
What it does:

Press Ctrl+Shift+B (or Cmd+Shift+B on Mac) â†’ runs default task

Go to Terminal â†’ Run Task to pick any task

Auto-installs dependencies, runs tests, builds project

4. .vscode/launch.json â€” Auto-Configure Debugging
This sets up debugging so you can hit F5 and debug instantly.

json
{
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "name": "Debug Python Script",
      "type": "python",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${file}",
      "console": "integratedTerminal"
    },
    {
      "name": "Debug Rust Binary",
      "type": "lldb",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceFolder}/target/debug/hypercode",
      "args": [],
      "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}"
    },
    {
      "name": "Debug Node.js App",
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "program": "${workspaceFolder}/src/index.js",
      "skipFiles": ["<node_internals>/**"]
    }
  ]
}
What it does:

Press F5 â†’ auto-starts debugger

Breakpoints, step-through, variable inspection â€” all ready to go
